page.description: Move an array entry from one position to another.
page.original:
&ltARRAY>.MOVE() Syntax &ltARRAY>.MOVE( From as N, To as N ) ArgumentDescription FromThe current position of the element being moved. ToThe new position of the element being moved.
Description The &ltARRAY>.MOVE() method moves an element in a single dimensional array From the specified position specified To the specified position. Example ElementValue A[1]Orange A[2]Banana A[3]Apple A[4]Pineapple A[5]Mango A.MOVE(4,2) ElementValue A[1]Orange A[2]Pineapple A[3]Banana A[4]Apple A[5]Mango
Assume you have a property array. dim px[2] as P px[1].NAME = "sam" px[1].city = "boston" px[2].NAME = "colin" px[2].city = "ithaca"
The array "looks" like this: ElementNameCity Px[1]SamBoston Px[2]ColinIthaca
To move element 2 into element 1, you issue the command: px.move(2,1)
Now, the array "looks" like this: ElementNameCity Px[1]ColinIthaca Px[2]SamBoston
See Also Array Functions and Methods
